questions.question: Cities provide water to their citizens. The majority of these citizens
choices: pay a water bill to government-owned water companies.
do not get billed for water use; taxes pay their water costs.

questions.question: Aquifers
choices: are usually naturally renewable by rainwater.
should continue to provide more than enough water for drinking and irrigation well into the future.

questions.question: Land subsidence and sinkholes are problems that sometimes occur as water is withdrawn. These sometimes occur in/at/beneath
choices: the Rocky Mountains, where water is withdrawn from rivers.
the Great Lakes, as we pump clean water from beneath the lakes.
middle and southwestern states where the aquifer beneath is being depleted.

questions.question: Hydroelectric dams along large rivers
choices: allow production of relatively cheap electricity.
reduce soil fertility downriver by preventing flooding

this will stimulate these economies by employing many people to build the pipes/aqueducts/etc. to move the water.
